intro: Aniselytron milioides, commonly known as the slender milletgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is native to regions of Africa and the Middle East. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its seeds are often used as a traditional food source in some parts of its native range. Aniselytron milioides is adapted to arid environments and is known for its resilience in poor soil conditions.
